pasādehi.example_1: “Kokālika, have confidence in Sāriputta and Moggallāna,

mukhena.example_1: you choose a losing hand with your own mouth:
mukhena.comment: with the mouth; by means of speech

uddhareyya.sutta_1: gaṅgā yamunā aciravatī sarabhū mahī, tato puriso dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni uddhareyya.
uddhareyya.example_1: Suppose a person was to draw two or three drops of water from such a place.

sañcarati.example_1: where the lightning flashes and the heavens thunder

ottapeti.example_1:
athāyaṃ  [atthāyaṃ-itipi dī. ni. 2.290] itarā pajā,
puññabhāgāti me mano,
saṅkhātuṃ nopi sakkomi,
musāvādassa ottapanti [ottapeti,
ottappeti].

saṃvejehīti.sutta_1: tena hi tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, bhiyyoso mattāya brahmānañca brahmaparisañca brahmapārisajje ca saṃvejehī’ti.
saṃvejehīti.example_1: Well then, brahmin, stir them up even more!’

viññāpetunti.sutta_1: pahomi khvāhaṃ, āvuso, brahmaloke ṭhito sahassilokadhātuṃ sarena viññāpetun’ti.
viññāpetunti.example_1: “Standing in the realm of divinity, I can make my voice heard throughout the thousandfold galaxy.”’

tavevetaṃ.example_1: It still belongs to you, brahmin,

sambhuñjati.sutta_1: yo kho, brāhmaṇa, akkosantaṃ paccakkosati, rosentaṃ paṭiroseti, bhaṇḍantaṃ paṭibhaṇḍati, ayaṃ vuccati, brāhmaṇa, sambhuñjati vītiharatīti.
sambhuñjati.example_1: Someone who, when abused, harassed, and attacked, abuses, harasses, and attacks in return is said to eat the food and have a reaction to it.

vuttiresā.example_1: Since there is such a principle, brahmin, <j>that’s how they live.
vuttiresā.comment: this is their way of life

paricaritvā.sutta_1: atha kho sundarikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo aggiṃ juhitvā aggihuttaṃ paricaritvā uṭṭhāyāsanā samantā catuddisā anuvilokesi:
paricaritvā.example_1: Then he surveyed the four quarters, wondering,

vivari.sutta_1: atha kho bhagavā sundarikabhāradvājassa brāhmaṇassa padasaddena sīsaṃ vivari.
vivari.example_1: When he heard Bhāradvāja of Sundarikā’s footsteps the Buddha uncovered his head.

yasseso.sutta_1: “na khvāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya yasseso habyaseso bhutto sammā pariṇāmaṃ gaccheyya aññatra, brāhmaṇa, tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā.
yasseso.example_1: “Brahmin, I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Divinities, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who can properly digest these leftovers, except for the Realized One or one of his disciples.

kāyaṃ.sutta_1: atha kho bhāradvājagotto brāhmaṇo te balībadde gavesanto yena so vanasaṇḍo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā addasa bhagavantaṃ tasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe nisinnaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
kāyaṃ.example_1: While looking for them he went to that forest grove, where he saw the Buddha sitting down cross-legged, his body set straight, and mindfulness established in his presence.

ekaputtā.example_1: with one or two children each:

bahudhītarena.example_1:
dhanañjānī ca akkosaṃ,
asurindaṃ bilaṅgikaṃ,
ahiṃsakaṃ jaṭā ceva,
suddhikañceva aggikā,
sundarikaṃ bahudhītarena ca te dasāti.

esaṃ.example_1: What do you want? What are you looking for?

mānatthaddho.sutta_1: tena kho pana samayena mānatthaddho nāma brāhmaṇo sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasati.
mānatthaddho.example_1: Now at that time a brahmin named Stuck-Up was residing in Sāvatthī.

visūkaṃ.example_1: my jungle’s cut at the root, it’s withered away.
